location.merchant_description_html: You can save your glances of pity for the next person. When people find out I’m a vegetarian, they gasp before taking another bite of their onion-laden Cheesesteak and mumbling, “I am SO sorry.” Well, I’m getting my kicks with the Vegetarian Chicken Cheeseteak. What, you thought vegetarians couldn’t eat well too? We can split the menu in half: Heavily-meated Best House Special Pizza for you. Hot cheese slice for me. Honey-dipped Fried Chicken Platter for you. Veggie Lasagna Platter for me. Do I detect a hint of envy at the sight of my massive Eggplant Stromboli? Who’s hosting the pity party, now?

Good eats are hard to keep secret, and the katsu’s out of the bag on Okinawa Teriyaki: come 11:30AM, the line out the door says it all, and a trip inside is further proof. Orders of Spicy Katsu (deep-fried meat of your choice on rice, with a spicy sauce) jolt customers from their mid-morning slump. Plates of ramen & yakisoba whisper sweet nothings from dish to mouth. The best part? Okinawa’s portions are so big, you can relive the whole thing for dinner. And there is one insider tip: beat the lunch line & call your order in.

We need balance in life. Highs come with lows. Adventure comes with discipline, and miniskirts get paired with sweaters, not tank tops. In the hotter months, I need a little dessert with just a few calories: fro-yo time! I go for fruity flavors like the Passion Fruit and balance it with rich chocolate chips and nuts. Other times I need my vanilla fix, and I balance it with fresh fruits like mango, kiwi, and strawberry. Sometimes I go twice a day...I mean, it’s all about, er, balance right?

Next on 48 Hours Mystery: Pizza Express. Just last week, a customer went crazy after just one bite of the Seafood Special pizza. Was it the thick, chewy crust that got her? Or the heavy helpings of savory shrimp, clams and fresh garlic? We sent investigators to check out the scene. After several hours, they had not reported back. Later, they were seen inside, devouring a monstrous stack of Chicken Wings and violently diving their forks into slices of Amaretto Cheesecake. This mystery remains unsolved, so we leave it in your hands, Bernal Heights. Pizza Express: dangerously delicious or perfectly cheesy?

Screw square (or should I say Block...) movie genre titles like Drama and Comedy. The Video Underground in JP keeps their rentals real. Maybe you need a gritty Drug n’ Alcohol flick like Traffic or Blow. Perhaps you want something that Smells like Teen Spirit like Jawbreaker. The small-store quirks don’t end there...the horror movies are organized by monster in order of ferociousness. Grab a membership and gain access to the specialty film shop’s 15,000 movies and 25-seat outdoor theater. Did we mention that the place is flanked by take-out Chinese restaurants? Insta-night in.

Grab a flick weekdays from 1PM-11PM or on weekends from 11AM-11PM.

3D TVs may be the latest craze when it comes to realistic viewing, but they still can’t make images on the screen actually appear in your hands. So what do you do when watching your favorite episode of Cupcake Wars and you just have to have the sweet concoction that is dripping with dark chocolate and topped with a gorgeous garnish? Head over to The Cupcake Counter. They can satisfy any palette with old classics and new creations like the Ice Cream Cupcake Sandwich. If you’ve had a really long day and could use a shot--of sugar that is, try the Frosting Shot. Even the glass is edible! At Cupcake Counter your TV dreams become a reality.

Flame Café totally fails the traditional fast food test. Greasy grub? Nope. Mystery ingredients? Nada. Breakfast wraps tanning under hot lights for hours? None, I tell you! The multiple choice is a bomb, and the essay’s no better: noting their cheap prices, quick service, & friendly staff, points are flying from the page. Flame features $1.99 breakfast wraps, lunch deals, & specials like the avocado-packed Salsa Burger. One thing’s for sure: they’re not getting any gold stars from gross-out chain stops. Thank goodness.

Gregory Peck and I weave in and out of Loop traffic on our robin's egg blue Vespa à la Roman Holiday. I'm hankering for a pick-me-up. "Caffè RōM it is!" he declares. *Swoon* He always knows just what to say. At our RōM away from Rome, he orders "the usual,” a perfectly made solo espresso enjoyed 'truly Italian' style... standing at their beautiful bar. For me? A Jo Jo panini: prosciutto, fresh mozz, artichoke hearts, basil, tomatoes and spices. And to send us on our merry RōM-an way, a hazelnut gelato and a Nocciola: espresso with nutella, condensed milk, whipped cream, and nuts. Now that's Vero Italiano!

Finding the perfect beer and chicken combination is kind of like finding a perfect pair of shoes... you’ve gotta try them all to know which one is perfect for you. Sample your way through Lemon Pepper Wings, boneless bites of Garlic Romano or fiery Hot Wings. And we doubt most would object to searching for the best brew for your chicken bites. The Wing Ranch is serving up beer by the bottle or on draft. Here’s a fun game: hot wing battle. See who can eat the most wings in a couple minutes. Whoever loses foots the bill for Fried Pickle Spears, Fish & Shrimp for the next few visits to the Ranch. #HotDeal

Sample your way through Lemon Pepper Wings, boneless bites of Garlic Romano or fiery Hot Wings. And we doubt most would object to searching for the best brew for your chicken bites. The Wing Ranch is serving up beer by the bottle or on draft. Here’s a fun game: hot wing battle. See who can eat the most wings in a couple minutes. Whoever loses foots the bill for Fried Pickle Spears, Fish & Shrimp for the next few visits to the Ranch. #HotDeal

At most markets, toilet paper and eggs take center stage. But Market Across the Street doesn’t fall under the category of “most markets.” They’ve got rows of perfectly crafted cupcakes. Wipe your eyes and re-check the name on the door if you’d like, but this ain’t no bakery. MATS sells fresh-baked favorites from local shops like Hollman & Finch Bread Co., The Cupcake Factory and Southern Sweets. So, when you’ve consecutively crossed off “Buy dog food. Get shampoo. Pick up beer & wine,” from your list, reward yourself with a sweet, baked treat. Betcha “most markets” can’t do that...

We had heard rumblings about an 18” cheesesteak in the Art Museum area, but weren’t convinced that it actually existed. We were hoping to hunt it down after scoping out a cozy, family-run, Italian-inspired spot called Angelino’s Restaurant Pizzeria...when coincidental insanity struck. This friendly spot WAS the home of the aforementioned monster. We had unassumingly walked directly into its den, which by the way is hooked up with free wifi and a BYOB policy. Coming face-to-face with endless layers of steak and seared onions was intimidating, but we noticed that everything on the menu was seriously substantial. Word to the wise: it’s wild and there will be leftover wreckage. Don’t panic, just reheat and repeat!

With an unassuming name like Corner Pizza, you’d assume it was a run-of-the-mill spot. That works for me... it’s better if the masses don’t know about stone-cold Brookhaven Betty. Her expertly baked crust is covered by smoked salmon, goat cheese, capers and shallots for a unique, gourmet pie. The twist: it’s served cold except for the crust! The owner of Corner Pizza was originally a baker (try the Cannolis,) so the crust is perfectly blistered and crisp. On Poker Saturdays, the highest rollers wager one of CP’s Buckets of Champagne, stocked with Miller High Life (the champagne of the beer world.)

Buckhead Barbecue Co., if you’re trying to make me fall in love with you... it’s working. You can always butter me up with a hefty chunk of Cornbread. When I dig into the BBC Rib Tips, I murmur, “I love you.” And I mean it. They’re great dry, or slathered in signature sauces: I can go Memphis Sweet, Hotlanta, Texas Dark Molasses and more. The love affair started with the Thank Ya, Thank Ya Very Much sandwich: one heavy, pan-fried bite of chunky peanut butter, soft banana slices and bacon was enough to sell me. So how ‘bout it, BBC? Let’s rendezvous again tomorrow night... bring ALL your sauces.

Awhile back, I realized that a draft-poured glass of Stella Artois makes the perfect dining companion at Mojo Pizza N Pub. It plays well with a Graveyard Pizza, cluttered with smoked bacon, smoked ham and sausage. There’s a full bar here that doesn’t judge. Last time I told a chick that I love looking at the Risin’ Sun, she called me soft and retreated before I could explain that it’s a pillowy pizza, patterned with pineapple, jalapenos and red peppers. When Trivia Night hits on Tues and Weds, a pint of Pabst is the perfect companion. Recollections of the 90’s flow easier when beer-induced.

It never rains at Viva Burrito... ever. The sky-painted ceilings and bright walls call for a food-flingin’ fiesta, so grab a menu. First thing’s first: a bottle of beer is a necessary support system for all meal-time decisions. From there, it is all about the Burrito. Choose from options like Lamb & Spinach, Shrimp and Steak. Each 10’’ flour tortilla is served with rice, black beans and salsa fresca, but don’t think you’re limited to a singular salsa selection. The salsa bar is full of choices. By the time you decide between Quesadillas, Tacos and Salads, your beer is gone... time for another.

A lot of pizza spots boast “the best slice in New York City.” You’d have to be a fool to believe them all, but Previti Pizza has been voted the number one Midtown lunch destination for two years in a row by MidtownLunch.com. That title alone gives it a helluva lot more clout than most. If you’re looking for the real deal, try the Artichoke Slice; a decadent mixture of crispy crust, tender chokes, and gooey truffle cream sauce. But, a good New Yorker never believes the hype, so get out there and try it for yourself!

James Hook & Co. has a few unusual greeters at the front door: live, monster-sized lobsters. People come from across the country to get their claws on some of the freshest Shrimp, Alaskan King Crab Legs and Maine Sea Scallops. While you’re surveying the tanks, sink your teeth into a tender, chunky Lobster Roll. Out of state seafood lovers can have live lobsters packed for flight in an insulated container, designed to keep them kickin’. They’ll make it home, fresh and intact. We can’t say the same for the Clam Chowder... there’s a good chance you’ll devour that before you leave the premises.

Student bookworms and working professionals, we know you're overworked and underfed. Luckily Zigo provides good food for busy people. It'll take less than 5 mins. and cost less than $10 (queue the choir of angels!) Bet you can't say you've had Vietnamese Rice Noodle Salad with Asian Chicken this week! From inventive sandwiches to hot pasta, chips to single serving canisters of Sour Patch Kids--the offerings at Zigo will make you want to shred your takeout menus and banish that food court foul play for life!
location.name: Zigo

location.merchant_description_html: “Yeah, I’ll get a decent made-to-order burger and fries for under $5 when the bars stay open past 2 and the Green Line runs without delays.” Ok, clearly the local lunch scene has left you...sour. But, there is a place campaigning for YOU. Fill-A-Buster Restaurant is bringing back the $5 meal with a vengeance. Pancakes and a coffee? That’ll run you four bucks and a nickel. A sizeable Greek Salad? Four and a quarter. And last but not least: A cheeseburger is $4.55 WITH fries. Looks like you’ll need a new “when-pigs-fly” metaphor eh? You can think of one as you filibuster your lunch break...presumably at Fill-A-Buster Restaurant.

Gasp! We have not reviewed this place yet! No. One. Panic. Our usual snarky firestorm will be up shortly...but in the meantime, we suggest that you go rogue and check this place out anyway. Hey, maybe we can compare notes after?

I love the pop of olives on my Arctic Char, and that they don’t come from inside a jar. I love hazelnuts in my Mushroom Soup, and that truffle cream is mixed in too. I love sage on my Escargot, I love that this place is BYO. I love Cherry-Walnut Turnovers fixed with butterscotch. I love my Malted Milk Chocolate Ice Cream with peanut butter ganache. With Tangerine Cheesecake, I always have a ball. But mostly, I love that I’m never too full for more; not even close, not even a little bit, not even at all.

Chef Miguel is like a second father to me. When the world showed me just how tough and flavorless it could be, he was right there with a Shrimp Ceviche Tostada. One taste and it became clear that seasoning was very, very real. When fast food threatened to kick me in the gut, Chef Miguel introduced me to the Half Sandwich & Fruit Salad combo. I learned that lunch doesn’t need to leave me feeling guilty especially when I have a BLT and fresh fruit, smothered in yogurt and granola. Yeah, one day I’ll have a menu just like his. For now, I’ll just sip on my Peach Riot smoothie and savor the flavor.

I surprised my wife with a fresh lunch. I watched as she dipped her fork into a mountain of Whole Kernel Corn, flavored with sweet butter. She gasped. “YOU made THIS?” I smiled. From there, she plowed through Mashed Potatoes & Gravy. Lastly, a Quarter Chicken, marinated and flame-charbroiled. At the first bite of tender meat, she moaned. “Oh honey, it’s amazing.” When she reached for a hug, she felt the crinkle under my shirt, then yanked it up to reveal the bag from Nick’s Pit Stop. She gasped again. I braced myself. “Fast food can taste THAT good?!” Then she passed out.

I'm a smart girl, and I live by a few smart rules. 1. Don't buy a dress without a pocket. 2. Don't settle when you want to eat a pocket. A pita pocket that is. My appetite has high standards, and that's why I go to The Pita Pit. I get regal with The Greek God's special sauce on chicken souvlaki and lamb gyro pocket. I munch with the hemp-dawning crunch bunch on hummus, veggies and feta in a wheat pita. My smartest rule? Using the interactive nutrition guide. Helps me keep the Greek God's in my pocket ;)
location.merchant_name: Pita Pit (2404 North Lincoln Ave, Chicago)

location.merchant_description_html: Mason has the swag of parents Scott Disick and Kourtney Kardashian. Suri’s got that class from Katie Holmes and Tom Cruise. But there’s a whole new crew of trendy tots in town and they’re all coming from a shopping spree at Hatched in Jamaica Plain. Inspired by her own kids, JP resident Liz Vittori-Koch opened the adorable shop with more than just style in mind. The toys are eco-friendly, the fabrics are organic, and there are even goodies for mom too! It’s time to go from diaper to dapper, babe.

My alarm rang, as planned. Saturday, 7AM. I threw back my sheets to reveal a jogging suit, complete with sneaks. Within minutes, I was sprinting to Blue Frog Bakery. When I arrived, I snagged several Pecan Sticky Buns, rejuvenated with a hot cup of Rao’s Coffee, and stashed away a few scones. Customers behind me grew impatient as I waited for my slow-roasted Blue Frog Bao sandwich. When my order was complete, I’d cleaned out the entire pastry case. As I left with my bounty, I smiled at other disappointed customers. Hey, early bird gets the Dark Chocolate Almond Croissant Bread Pudding.

Chickpea is nestled in the Ukrainian Village. The restaurant, owned by Jerry Suqi and cheffed by his mother Amni has been rated the #1 Middle Eastern restaurant by TimeOut Chicago. Under the chandelier lights of the authentic Palestinian cafe, you can enjoy a dip trio appetizer featuring hummus, baba ghannooj and Koosa ma Laban as you peruse the main menu filled with lamb kababs, falafel and koosa...an addictive veggie stew. Sounds deliciously quaint, right? Ready for the surprise ending? There’s an enormous gold-framed Batman portrait on the wall. BOOM! Vintage arcade games dot the dining room. POW! That mural on the wall? It’s filled with action-movie posters straight from 1984. CHA-CHING!
